oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ida B. Wells- Barnett
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ida B. Wells shown from the shoulders up. Caption reads "Ida B. Wells Barnett, Chicago, Ill., Editor Conservator."

Ida B. Wells is a native of Memphis who was a journalist, feminist, and civil activist whose challenge of segregated public accommodations and opposition of lynching during the Jim Crow era made her one of the most well-known African-American women of the nineteenth century.
